title: Indie Games Showcase E3 2021 Kinda Funny Live Reactions
description:
Tim, Mike, Andy, and Blessing react to some damn cool indie games.

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Blessing - http://www.twitter.com/BlessingJr 
Andy - http://www.twitter.com/TheAndyCortez 
Mike - http://www.twitter.com/SnowBikeMike
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Blessing Adeoye Jr., and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

exciting uh yeah wait they look cool too i think it's over kev yeah that was it yeah i think that's it yeah oh 15 minutes is perfect in and out love that now pretty cool a lot of a lot of fun games there i thought they presented it well i think like that was an interesting type of showcase without any any host or any type of uh explanations or it was just trailers back to back to back but i think that it kind of worked like they were well presented trailers and showed off cool looking games yeah i would have sat i would have sat and watched this for another 45 minutes you know i think that it was pretty well paced all the games for the most part look pretty cool there were a few few things in there that felt like they were duds but it being in a condensed showcase like that i think did them justice in terms of letting things not get lost in the shuffle if one game's not for you maybe the next one will be and giving each of these games their own time to shine i think in a smaller

them justice in terms of letting things not get lost in the shuffle if one game's not for you maybe the next one will be and giving each of these games their own time to shine i think in a smaller showcase meant that they're going to stick around longer in terms of how they sit in your brain yeah i could have gone for another 15 minutes i don't know how long it could have stretched that out but i liked like i said before all new games that we haven't seen over the course of the weekend and yeah i think there's some for everyone right i think there was a couple that made us pop right we saw that cool airplane simulator that i really enjoyed the paper airplane sim and then fallen aces i think that's one now everybody's gonna circle and look at because i want to play that right away what a cool one so yeah good for them and then of course space cows you know give me that milk yeah this is the first one that i kind of wanted more from i like of all of e3 obviously this is definitely the

cool one so yeah good for them and then of course space cows you know give me that milk yeah this is the first one that i kind of wanted more from i like of all of e3 obviously this is definitely the shortest of the presentations but i was hoping we got about double the length i was hoping to see some more some newer titles especially since we felt we got into that rhythm of oh these are games we haven't seen before cool we're going to continue to see games we haven't seen before this is going to be rad and then it just kind of abruptly ended so i'm kind of sad about that yeah i wish they i wish they framed one of those as a one more thing you know these are all games that we've never heard of and so i think maybe that's that's hard to do but it did feel like it ended very abruptly and maybe that maybe they didn't they don't want it to be like this bigger thing maybe they were like hey this is just a segment in our large e3 stream which is fine um but yeah for it to like stop out of
